turns.content: What is the best software for encoding and decoding audio files with a minimum of lossy data?

The best software for encoding and decoding audio files with minimum lossy data would be a lossless audio codec such as FLAC (Free Lossless Audio Codec). Other popular lossless audio codecs include ALAC (Apple Lossless Audio Codec) and Monkey's Audio (APE). These codecs ensure that audio quality is preserved during encoding and decoding processes.
Do you know if any media players support FLAC files?

Yes, there are many media players that support FLAC files. Some of the most popular media players that support FLAC include:

1. VLC Media Player
2. Foobar2000
3. MediaMonkey
4. Winamp
5. Clementine

These media players can play FLAC files without the need for any additional plugins or software.
